ins.il: plural in form but singular in construction

dt: {bc}something having a specified influence or effect

dt.t: the rain was good {wi}news{/wi} for lawns and gardens

dt: {bc}material reported in a {a_link|newspaper} or news periodical or on a {a_link|newscast}

dt.t: listened to the {wi}news{/wi} on the radio
The layoffs were big {wi}news{/wi} in this part of the state.
We saw it on the evening {wi}news{/wi}.

shortdef: something having a specified influence or effect

dt: {bc}an organization that supplies news to subscribing newspapers, periodicals, and newscasters

shortdef: an organization that supplies news to subscribing newspapers, periodicals, and newscasters

dt: {bc}the office where news is gathered to be reported in a newspaper, on television, etc.

shortdef: the office where news is gathered to be reported in a newspaper, on television, etc.

dt: {bc}a report on an important piece of news that is given in the middle of another television or radio show
often used ironically when one is saying something that is not new or surprising

shortdef: a report on an important piece of news that is given in the middle of another television or radio show —often used ironically when one is saying something that is not new or surprising

dt: {bc}information or a report about (something that happened)

dt.t: It was late summer when {it}news of{/it} his death arrived.

shortdef: information or a report about (something that happened)

dt: {bc}something one is hearing for the first time {bc}something one did not previously know

dt.t: "The concert has been canceled." "Well, that's {it}news to me{/it}."

shortdef: something one is hearing for the first time : something one did not previously know

ins.il: plural in form but singular in construction

dt: {bc}one that is troublesome, unwelcome, or dangerous

dt.t: stay away from him, he's {it}bad news{/it}

shortdef: one that is troublesome, unwelcome, or dangerous

dt: {bc}communication, information, or entertainment that is not {d_link|news|news} or not {d_link|newsworthy|newsworthy}

dt.t: … the airwaves will be jammed with news and {wi}non-news{/wi} of the most hair-raising presidential derby on record.

shortdef: communication, information, or entertainment that is not news or not newsworthy —often used before another noun

dt: city and port on the James River and the Hampton Roads channel in southeastern Virginia {it}population{/it} 180,719

shortdef: city and port on the James River and the Hampton Roads channel in southeastern Virginia population 180,719
